speaker: Daphne
text: There's a veterinarian's five minutes from here, I'm sure he can make Eddie cough up that ring.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right then, off you go, both of you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hurry, please!  We've only got the skywriter until five!

speaker: Frasier
text: Clint, would you please turn up that air conditioning to the maximum?  That ice sculpture over there is by the renowned artist Arthur Nudzac, and it's melting already! _Clint does.  In a few seconds, however, the unit sputters and dies with a rattle._

speaker: Frasier
text: What's that?

speaker: Clint
text: We just blew out the compressor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just don't just stand there, please, call a repairman. _Clint exits.  Roz knocks on the glass, with a crowd of highly agitated guests behind her.  They are coughing._

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier!  Frasier!

speaker: Roz
text: You have got to let these people in!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Roz, I'm sorry, I know it's warm...

speaker: Roz
text: No, it's not the heat.  That truck that just crashed was full of cattle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the sound of gentle mooing in the background might lend a pastoral effect.

speaker: Roz
text: Cattle, Frasier -- large, un-diapered cattle that just heard a cannon go off!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  All right, I'll handle this.  Um, wedding guests, we thank you for your cooperation and your patience... _Seeing the door open, the guests ignore him and push their way in, holding their noses._

speaker: Frasier
text: People, people, please! _But he's helpless to stem the tide.  FADE TO:  Scene Eight -- Vet's Office Daphne and Niles are seated in the waiting room with Eddie.  Also seated are a man with a carrying cage, and a woman, Rachel, playing with a monkey perched on her shoulder.  The vet, a young man named Dr. Hauck, comes out with a pill bottle. _

speaker: Hauck
text: [_to the owner_] Okay, here are your pills, twice a day. [_leans down to the box's door_] And you feel better, Mr. Kitty Cat.

speaker: Hauck
text: Who's next?

speaker: Rachel
text: I am. [_the monkey cheeps_]

speaker: Hauck
text: Oh, gosh.  [_N.B. Arleen Sorkin has a long affiliation with_ Frasier _.  Aside from being the wife of executive producer Christopher Lloyd, she often voiced the parts of callers into Frasier's show during rehearsals and studio tapings, before the celebrity voices were dubbed in later. Of course, I remember her best as the voice of Harley Quinn on_ Batman: the Animated Series _ -- her shining moment was successfully performing "Amazing Grace" on a kazoo. -- Mike Lee_]

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, we have an emergency here.  Our dog swallowed a ring, and it's holding up a whole wedding.

speaker: Rachel
text: Go ahead, I can wait.

speaker: Daphne/Niles
text: ** Thank you./Thank you so much. _Reset to: Examining Room Daphne and Niles follow Dr. Hauck in and place Eddie on the surgical table._

speaker: Hauck
text: Boy, no easy ones today.  Talk about hitting the ground running.

speaker: Niles
text: Is this your first day?

speaker: Hauck
text: Yep.  I'm not in Kansas anymore.

speaker: Niles
text: Where'd you go to vet school?

speaker: Hauck
text: Kansas.  All right, here we go.  Now if you hold his mouth open for me, I'll see if I can get his paw down his throat... [_off their shocked looks_] I'm just kidding, I'm just... you know what, why don't I just take your pooch to the other room here, and I'll just, I'll be right back.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.

speaker: Hauck
text: Excuse me. [_picks up Eddie_] All right, buddy.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: He has no idea what he's doing.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, he's just new at this, he's nervous.

speaker: Daphne
text: I've been a bit nervous myself lately, ever since me brothers showed up.

speaker: Niles
text: Really?  Why?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, you know, the way they keep patting my stomach and saying, "he's a Moon all right!"

speaker: Niles
text: [_relieved_] Oh my God, yes!

speaker: Daphne
text: And every time they say that, all I can think is, what if he's not?  What if he's like you and Frasier?

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, a Moon boy I know how to handle.  But what if he's a little genius -- teasing me in French by the time he's six?

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughing_] That is so funny -- I've been worried he's gonna turn out like one of your brothers.  I was sure when he kicked that speaker off your belly, that you had a little Simon in there.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_chuckles_] They are a handful, my brothers.  I can just imagine the hell they're raising back there.

speaker: Niles
text: With an open bar? _They chuckle -- then Daphne suddenly clutches her stomach and we hear the sound of water trickling onto the floor. _

speaker: Daphne
text: [_gasps_] Oh my God, my water just broke!  The baby's coming!

speaker: Niles
text: Because I said "open bar"?!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, okay, all right, don't-don't panic, there's plenty of time to get you to a hospital.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh! -- the hell there is, it's coming right now!  Oh...!

speaker: Hauck
text: Here's your ring.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, here, here -- [_grabs the ring_] Call an ambulance, my wife's having a baby!

speaker: Daphne
text: There's no time for an ambulance!  Oh!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God!

speaker: Hauck
text: Oh my God!  Uh, uh, you know what, why don't you-you call 9-1-1...

speaker: Niles
text: All right!

speaker: Hauck
text: ...and-and I'll just, I'll just get started here.

speaker: Hauck
text: Oh, wait!  Wait, wait, wait! [_they stop and look at him_] I'm going to wash my hands!

speaker: Daphne
text: Are you sure you know what you're doing?!

speaker: Hauck
text: Oh, I've assisted in many deliveries, ma'am.  In fact, one just took blue ribbon at the Kansas State Fair.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh!  Oh my God!  Oh!

speaker: Hauck
text: Easy now, you're doing great, girl.

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't call me that, I'm not a bloody poodle!

speaker: Niles
text: [_into phone_] Yes, hello, hello!  We're at, we're at, uh... [_checks the phone_] 1206 East Vilage Road, my wife's gone into labor! [_to her_] They say the hospital is twenty miles away, can you make it if I drive you-?

speaker: Niles
text: She says no.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, they're on their way, they're on their way, now you just calm down.  Focus on me, and breathe.  Breathe... _He begins Lamaze breathing, inhaling rapidly and blowing his cheeks out.  Daphne looks at him and does the same.  However, Niles's panic gets the better of him and his inhalations quickly turn to wheezing as he starts to hyperventilate, then passes out onto the floor._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh!  Oh, for God's sakes!  Oh! _Dr. Hauck is still struggling into rubber gloves and a surgical mask when Rachel opens the door._

speaker: Rachel
text: Is everything okay in here?

speaker: Hauck
text: We're fine.

speaker: Rachel
text: Okay.  If you need any help, I'm a registered nurse. [_starts to leave_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, get the hell back in here!

speaker: Hauck
text: Easy, girl.

speaker: Daphne
text: Stop that! _As she keeps gasping, we FADE TO:  Scene Nine -- The Branford Inn Back at the Inn, Frasier is presiding over chaos.  All the guests are crowded into the dining room, sweating like pigs and fanning themselves frantically.  In desperation, Roz opens the door and starts fanning the air with it. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, do not open a window until they tow that cattle truck!

speaker: Roz
text: God, it's a million degrees in here!  We gotta get a breeze... [_coughs_] Oh my God! _Roz, Frasier, and all the guests stagger and cough as the fetid breeze from outside fills the room.  Martin and Ronee, dressed in suit and white gown, enter the room, and the stench hits them in the face._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh my God! [_he and Ronee hold their noses_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_putting a blithe face on it_] Dad, Ronee!  We're almost ready to start!

speaker: Martin
text: What's that smell?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pretending_] Smell?

speaker: Guest
text: [_holding her nose_] Congratulations you two, everything's just perfect, sorry I can't stay!

speaker: Ronee
text: What's happening?

speaker: Frasier
text: There's been a bit of a mishap with a cattle truck, and-and the A.C.'s out.  But no matter!  Right, people?  It'll take more than that to mar our joy at seeing these two become Mr. and Mrs. Martin Crane! _BOOM!  Everyone jumps -- except Simon and Stephen, who just bellow with laughter again and clink their champagne glasses together.  In the midst of this chaos, Frasier's mobile rings. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Well, finally, Niles!  Stop babbling!  Listen, Niles, you'll have to speak up, I can't hear you with that baby screaming in the backgr... Oh my God! _He gets a joyous look on his face.  [_N.B. This scene was not shown in the U.K. broadcast._]  FADE OUT  END OF ACT THREE  ACT FOUR  Scene Ten -- Vet's Office Daphne is lying on the table, holding her newborn son.  Niles, looking haggard but happy, hugs her.  Rachel and Dr. Hauck are scrubbing down in the sink. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Isn't he perfect, Dad?

speaker: Niles
text: He certainly is, Mom.  He's got your eyes and my chin.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's got my hair.

speaker: Niles
text: You think so?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, he's got my hair.  Let go, dear.

speaker: Rachel
text: If you can part with him for just two seconds, I should finish cleaning him up.

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course.

speaker: Niles
text: We can't thank you two enough. _He looks at Dr. Hauck, whose mask is askew on his forehead, and who is struggling to remove his gloves._

speaker: Hauck
text: [_modest wave_] Oh, please.

speaker: Niles
text: Really, if there's ever anything that we can do for you...

speaker: Rachel
text: You can do me one quick favor: my Jason is kind of overdue for his lunch.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, of course. _CUT TO: Waiting Room The room is empty.  Frasier, Martin, and Ronee come in, still wearing their wedding clothes._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Niles?

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, some day, huh?  Getting married and meeting my grandson all in the same afternoon. _The door opens and there is Niles, holding a monkey tenderly under his arm and feeding him with a bottle._

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, you guys!  You're just in time, come on in!

speaker: Martin
text: [_to a gaping Frasier_] Don't stare, you were no prize at that age either! _Reset to: Examining Room Frasier, Martin and Ronee follow Niles in._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, look who's here.  Hello. _Rachel enters from the washroom with the baby swaddled, and gives him to Daphne._

speaker: Rachel
text: Here we go!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, he's beautiful!

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, that twin's gonna be jealous his whole life.

speaker: Rachel
text: Your ambulance should be here any minute, so I think I'm gonna go.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  Thank you again.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you.

speaker: Hauck
text: Uh, you sure you don't want me to check your monkey?

speaker: Rachel
text: [_embarrassed laugh_] Yeah, I'm sure. _She picks up Jason and his cage, and leaves.  Dr. Hauck excuses himself to the other room._

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_tickles the baby_] Hey there, you!  I'm the one who's gonna spoil you rotten.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you're so sweet to come down.  But what about your wedding, all those people?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, they'll keep.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, as long as there's an open bar.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to the baby_] Ooh!  Settle down there.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I guess that's our ride.  I'm so sorry we're going to miss your wedding.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, so are we.

speaker: Daphne
text: I feel like it's me own dad getting married.

speaker: Martin
text: [_pats her head_] Oh yeah, it's not gonna be the same without you guys up there.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, don't let me forget the rings.

speaker: Ronee
text: Hey, wait a minute!  Why don't we just get married here? I mean, we've got the rings, and-and the preacher...

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what about all the guests?

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, we can do it again for them later.  And at least this place only smells like a monkey.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm game.  Get cracking, Fras! _Martin and Ronee stand on one side of the table.  Daphne lies there, holding the baby.  Frasier and Niles stand on the other side, and Frasier takes some speech cards from his pocket._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'd better, uh, condense this just a bit... [_reading the cards_] No, I don't need that... and I don't need that. All right... ah. [_begins_] "It was the great thinker Horace Walpole..."

speaker: Martin
text: Don't need that.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chucks the card_] Well, all right then, uh... "Dearly beloved, we are gathered here..."

speaker: Rob
text: Someone call for an ambulance?

speaker: Martin
text: Just a couple seconds, please.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Niles, uh, why don't you give them the rings?

speaker: Niles
text: [_does_] Here.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll just cut to the chase here.  Uh, do you, Martin Crane take Ronee Lawrence to be your lawfully wedded wife, forsaking all others, until death do you part?

speaker: Martin
text: I do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you, Ronee Lawrence, take Martin Crane...?

speaker: Ronee
text: I do!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm tearing up.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, if they'd let me say what I planned to, you'd be bawling your eyes out right now.

speaker: Frasier
text: By the power vested in me, I now pronounce you man and wife. _They kiss tenderly and hug.  Hugs and laughter follow all around. Then Niles opens the door to Rob._

speaker: Niles
text: We're ready now. [_to Martin and Ronee_] We're so happy for you both.

speaker: Daphne
text: Congratulations. _The paramedics wheel a gurney in, and Niles takes the baby as they slide Daphne onto it._

speaker: Niles
text: And, you will always remember your anniversary, because it's the same day as your grandson's birthday.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, and Eddie's!

speaker: Ronee
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, never mind.

speaker: Ronee
text: Eddie's birthday is today?  So that's how you came up with May 15th for the hotel?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh...

speaker: Ronee
text: I knew it!  And you've been blaming the inn all this time -- oh, you are so busted! _She walks out, Martin follows her slowly.  Frasier, Niles, and Daphne watch him, concerned._

speaker: Martin
text: [_to the boys_] That was a short honeymoon. _The paramedics wheel Daphne out.  Niles follows.  FADE TO:_ **AN IDLE KING** _Scene Eleven - Apartment It is evening, the rain is pouring outside.  Frasier is sitting on his couch, enjoying a book and a glass of sherry.  After a few minutes, he closes his book, drains his glass, then picks up the cordless phone and dials._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Lilith.  Hey, it's me.  Yeah, listen, I was just calling to check out how Freddy's doing.  What, a new one? I thought he was smitten with the old one.  Well, you know, he gets that from me.  Back in my heyday, I had a new chess coach every month. [_chuckles_] Well, I'm... spending a lot of time alone lately.  Well, you know, Dad and Ronee are still on their honeymoon.  Oh yes, they thank you for that very thankful radon detector you sent.  Not seeing much of Niles and Daphne either, because they're so busy with the baby... Oh!  Uh, sorry to keep you.  Yeah, just, uh, just tell Freddy to call me.  Okay, bye, Lilith. _He hangs up.  He goes to the balcony door and opens it, listening to the sound of the rain.  Someone rings the doorbell.  Frasier eagerly goes to answer it, to a Moving Man._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Man
text: Here to pick up a chair?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  It's right there. _He points to the chair, which has been marked with strips of red tape on the front._

speaker: Man
text: Sorry I'm late.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all right.

speaker: Man
text: Been waiting long?

speaker: Frasier
text: Eleven years. _The Man levers the chair onto his dolly and wheels it to the door. But Frasier betrays some affection._

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, be careful with it. [_N.B. Cleto Augusto reprises his role as the Moving Man who brought Martin's chair to the apartment eleven years ago in[[1.01]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_1/the_good_son.html "The Good Son") "The Good Son."_] _Frasier contemplates the empty space where the chair was, then joyfully brings the Eames from the upper landing down, and places it in front of the TV, with its footstool.  He steps back and surveys the tableau with satisfaction.  He sits on the coffee table, looking around at his apartment. For the first time in eleven years, he's on his own.  He should be satisfied.  But after a minute, he realizes that he's not.  He picks up the phone again._

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, hi, it's Frasier.  Listen, about that San Francisco job... I think I'll take it. _He hangs up.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT FOUR  ACT FIVE  Scene Twelve -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier takes his seat with Noel and Gil from KACL._

speaker: Gil
text: Have you heard anything, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: About what?

speaker: Noel
text: The new station manager.  They're announcing today.

speaker: Gil
text: My stomach is in knots.  I just know they're going to replace sweet, kind-hearted Kenny with some ruthless, Draconian...

speaker: Noel
text: ...hard ass!

speaker: Gil
text: That would hardly make up for it. _Noel and Frasier share a knowing glance.  The Agent of Hell enters and disturbs the peace._

speaker: Bebe
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_standing_] Bebe.  Oh, I'll let you know if I hear anything, guys. [_goes to Bebe_]

speaker: Bebe
text: It's done.  When destiny calls, Bebe calls back and screws destiny to the wall.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, yes.  Shush, shush.  I don't want anyone to find out.  I'm not telling my family until this evening. [_motions her to the window seat_]

speaker: Bebe
text: I'm so proud of you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_digging in his pocket_] Oh, Bebe, listen, I have something for you.  I've decided to give away some of the things that I've accumulated through the years.  As sort of a... fresh start, you know.

speaker: Bebe
text: My baby's all grown up. [_She puts her hands on his face_] I look in your eyes and I see something there that I've never seen before.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wisdom?

speaker: Bebe
text: Crow's feet.  Sorry, darling, but you're going to be on TV now.  I talked to my face man, he can see you at four o'clock. [_dangles a card in front of him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Bebe, but no thanks.

speaker: Bebe
text: I'm not talking surgery.  Just talking a little tweaking, twenty minutes.  I've used him for years.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I'm sure he's very good at what he does, but still it's just not me.... _He is interrupted by a short, balding fat man in his late thirties, sticking his head round the door (Steve)._

speaker: Steve
text: I'm done next door, so I'll be in the car, Mom. [_N.B. To anyone who doubts that she's made a deal with Satan..._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taking card_] Four o'clock it is.  [_N.B. In Bebe's debut episode,[[1.09]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_9/selling_out.html "Selling Out") "Selling Out," she alluded to a daughter who was about to graduate from university.  But no episode after that mentioned any children._] _Bebe leaves in excitement and passes Roz who is talking on her cell phone._

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.  Thank you.  Bye.

speaker: Noel
text: You heard something, didn't you?

speaker: Roz
text: [_dazed_] Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, are you all right?

speaker: Gil
text: Of course not.  She's ashen with terror.  Spit it out, Roz. Who's the jack-booted tyrant whose fanny I'll be kissing till God knows when?

speaker: Roz
text: Me.

speaker: Gil
text: [_kneeling_] Joyful news, your majesty.

speaker: Frasier
text: You?!  Roz, congratulations!  Aren't you excited?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know.  It just hasn't sunk in yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's understandable.  I remember when I heard that my advice would be heard by millions of people and...

speaker: Roz
text: [_yelling in excitement_] It just sunk in!  I'm the boss! Who wants to go have champagne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, Roz, I'd love to, but I have to go to a doctor's appointment.  Can you come to my place for dinner tonight?

speaker: Roz
text: Sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, I'm so happy for you.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm just so excited. _Overcome with excitement, she grabs Frasier and kisses him on the lips.  Then she breaks and grabs Gil and kisses him on the lips. Then it's Noel's turn...  She stops, realizing that he's breathing shallowly, daring to hope. At first she's reluctant, but her excitement is so great that she goes ahead and grabs Noel and kisses him on the lips.  Noel, seizing the moment, throws his arms around her and returns the kiss passionately, bending her backwards.  After a while she finally manages to break free.  Noel looks thoroughly satisfied and puts his arm around her._

speaker: Gil
text: Well.  Was that worth waiting for?

speaker: Noel
text: [_still breathing heavily_] He asked you a question, Roz. **TO STRIVE, TO SEEK, TO FIND** _Scene Thirteen -- Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is on the phone in the kitchen.  He is playing with his eyes.  They won't stop streaming with tears._

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, it's Frasier.  When you get this, call me, please. I want to thank you for sending me to that quack of yours today!  He screwed something up and now my eyes won't stop watering. _Reset to: Living Room Meanwhile, Daphne is opening the door to Roz.  Martin and Ronee are already there, snuggled together on the couch now that the apartment is chair-less._

speaker: Daphne
text: There she is.

speaker: Roz
text: Congratulations.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, and to you.

speaker: Ronee
text: Hey, does anyone know what this big occasion is?  We had plans and Frasier made us cancel.

speaker: Daphne
text: We're not sure either.  He said he had some sort of an announcement to make.

speaker: Roz
text: Awww, there he is.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Martin
text: [_tickles him_] Hey, David, remember me?  I'm your grandpa.

speaker: Ronee
text: [_tickles him_] Yes, and I'm your... Sorry, I just, I can't say it yet.  [_N.B. In memory of David Angell._] _Reset to: Kitchen Roz enters to find a teary Frasier._

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I brought some champagne if... Were you just crying?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Roz, of course not.  Listen, could you take these out for me? [_passes her a tray of hors d'oeuvres_]

speaker: Roz
text: Sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. _Reset to: Living Room Roz returns._

speaker: Roz
text: Is Frasier okay?

speaker: Martin
text: Sure, why?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I think he was crying in the kitchen.  I hope he's okay.  He's been at the doctor an awful lot lately.

speaker: Niles
text: Has he?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, he went today and he missed a whole show because of an appointment last week.

speaker: Martin
text: He hasn't said anything to us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ronee, I saw you admiring this China pattern.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, yes, it's beautiful.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I'd like to make a gift of them to you as a complete set.

speaker: Ronee
text: Gosh, Frasier, thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.  Oh, Niles, I know how much you've always coveted this chess set. [_holds it up_]  And I want you to have it.

speaker: Niles
text: But this is your favourite.  This is the one you learned on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Which is why I want it to be the set that you teach that son of yours to play on.  I haven't forgot about you, Roz. I'll be right back.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't like this.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, now, let's not get alarmed.  It's marriage in the air and a new baby, it's just brought out his sentimental side. _The phone begins to ring and Roz goes to answer the phone.  But the machine picks up first._

speaker: Doctor
text: [_v.o. on machine_] Frasier, it's Dr. Hanning.  I'm really sorry about your results.  I know it doesn't look good but, um, I'm going to do everything I can for you.  Call me.  [_N.B. Rob Hanning wrote for the show._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh my God...

speaker: Martin
text: Do you think that's why he brought us all here tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are, Roz.  I thought this art deco mirror seemed like you. _He passes it to her, causing an immediate fit of emotion.  She sobs deeply._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well that just shows you.  I thought I'd get the bigger reaction from the chess set.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, what's going on here?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, giving all your stuff away? You're not going anywhere, are you...?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I didn't want to say anything until after dinner so as not to bring down the party, but...

speaker: Frasier
text: I see you're all ahead of me.  Uh... listen, a couple of weeks ago I got some unexpected news.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now you see, this is exactly what I was trying to avoid. You mustn't think of my leaving you as a sad thing, because I don't.  I think of it as an adventure.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Frasier, no....

speaker: Frasier
text: We all knew we weren't going to stay together forever.  I mean, that's not what life is about.  Cry, if you must, but I assure you, when I pass through that Golden Gate I will be smiling!

speaker: Martin
text: [_in utter misery_] Golden Gate?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  That's where I'm moving to!  San Francisco!

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: My new job.  I start next week.  Now don't just sit there choking back the tears.  Go ahead, let them out. _They instead begin laughing hysterically and hugging each other. Frasier is mystified.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Fourteen -- Frasier's Apartment The scene cuts to the end of the party.  Frasier, Martin and Niles are having brandy out on the balcony together as Roz, Daphne and Ronee sit in the living room.  _

speaker: Niles
text: To San Francisco.

speaker: Frasier
text: To San Francisco.

speaker: Martin
text: To San Francisco. _They clink glasses and take a swig - Martin's swig being considerably larger... what with finishing off the glass._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know it's just an hour by plane, so I'll be coming back up as often as you like.

speaker: Martin
text: We know, Fras.  Don't worry about us.

speaker: Niles
text: We're happy for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm happy for myself.  And scared too.  But it's a good scared.  Sort of the way I felt when I came here from Boston.  If I hadn't done that, just think of what I would have missed out on.

speaker: Niles
text: And, look what I would have missed out on. [_looking over at Daphne and David_] God, they are so beautiful.

speaker: Martin
text: And they'll stay like that as long as she keeps breast feeding. _Frasier and Niles share glances as Martin heads inside.  Daphne enters from the other door._

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, could you take the baby?  I need to get a blanket. _Reset to: Living Room Frasier and Niles enter the living room to find Martin snugly laid out on Frasier's designer Eames chair._

speaker: Martin
text: Mmmm, well this is pretty comfortable.  I would have been okay with this!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_changing subject_] Let me just help you with some of those dishes.

speaker: Martin
text: Ahh, handsome boy.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  And to think I had myself all worked up worrying that we would have nothing in common.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I've been there, Niles.  It all works out.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, Marty, we better get going.  I've got a crazy morning.

speaker: Roz
text: Me too.  I've got a seven-thirty and then I've got to fire someone.

speaker: Daphne
text: Who?

speaker: Roz
text: Whoever scheduled the seven-thirty meeting!

speaker: Daphne
text: We should go too, honey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, if you really must go, all right, but I tell you what, don't go without taking some of these eclairs with you. _As everyone heads for the door, the camera focuses on Frasier rushing in and out of the kitchen._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm on TV next week and the only thing worse than seeing them going to waste would be seeing them go to my waist! _Frasier chuckles at his own word play as he enters the living room with the eclairs.  He is surprised to find everyone stood waiting for him, heartbroken.  _

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Roz
text: Does it mean you're really leaving? [_chokes up_] What will I ever do without you? [_hugging him dearly_] You're the sweetest, most wonderful...

speaker: Martin
text: It's okay, Roz.  He's not going till next week.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let her talk, Dad!

speaker: Roz
text: You've always been just like a brother to me. [_breaking hug_] Which is weird, I know, because we slept together, but...

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh, move over, Roz. [_goes to hug him_] Do you know how many operas I'm gonna get dragged to now you're not around?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I promise I'll fly up for all the German ones!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, and he'll be here for Christmas... and Thanksgiving... and birthdays... and... [_convincing himself_] We'll be sick of this guy!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, Dad's right.  I mean, once I'm gone there'll be no getting rid of me. _Frasier moves towards his father.  Martin begins to tear up as he puts his hand on his son's face._

speaker: Martin
text: Thank you, Frasier.  For... well, you know. _They hug in a special moment that is so much more than the "one lousy thank you" which Frasier begged of his father in "The Good Son."_

speaker: Ronee
text: Go get �em, kid.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure. _They briefly hug.  Frasier then turns around to his dear brother and respected friend, Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: You already made me cry once tonight.  That's quite enough.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Coffee tomorrow?

speaker: Niles
text: Ten-thirty. _They shake hands.  After all, "a handshake is as good as a hug," as their mother once told them._

speaker: Niles
text: I'll miss the coffees. _The tears begin to spring as they denounce their mother's sentiments and hug tenderly._

speaker: Frasier
text: I love you.

speaker: Frasier
text: You all know how I feel about you, and the only reason I'm leaving is because I want what all of you have now: a new chapter.  Who knows if it'll even work out? [_looking to Martin_] But it's like that Tennyson poem Mom had us recite for you when we were kids.  Do you remember?

speaker: Martin
text: I think we're about to.

speaker: Frasier
text: It may be that the gulfs will wash us down, It may be we shall touch the Happy Isles, and though We are not now that strength which in old days Moved earth and heaven, that which we are, we are... _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Fifteen -- KACL The scene dissolves into the radio station as Frasier delivers his final show.  He is finishing the same Tennyson poem.  Roz is in the producer's chair, and a whole crowd of KACL staff is standing behind her in the booth, including Kenny, Noel, Gil, and Bebe. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Made weak by time and fate, but strong in will To strive, to seek, to find, and not to yield.  _Frasier gives Roz a glance of weary happiness.  As he delivers his farewell remarks, the camera slowly pans around until we are left with an image of Frasier finishing his show whilst another crowd, including Niles, Daphne, Martin, Ronee and little David watch silently on from behind the glass, in the corridor._

speaker: Frasier
text: I've been thinking about that poem a lot lately.  And I think what it says is that, while it's tempting to play it safe, the more we're willing to risk, the more alive we are.  In the end, what we regret most are the chances we never took.  And I hope that explains a little this journey on which I'm about to embark.  I have loved every minute with my KACL family and all of you.  For eleven years you have heard me say, "I'm listening."  Well, you were listening too.  And for that I am eternally grateful. Goodnight, Seattle.  _Frasier hangs up his headphones for the final time.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Sixteen -- Airplane Cabin The scene dissolves back to the present as Frasier finishes his story to Anne Ranberg, his fellow airline passenger. _

speaker: Frasier
text: We had a big party that night.  It was all very sweet.

speaker: Anne
text: What was that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good heavens. [_looking out of window_] We've touched down.

speaker: Anne
text: Already? [_laughs in amazement_] Well, thank you so much, I've never had an easier flight.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I've never had more delightful company.

speaker: Anne
text: I think it's great what you're doing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I just know I'd always regret it if I didn't take the chance.

speaker: Pilot
text: [_v.o_] Ladies and Gentleman, welcome to Chicago...
